title: Drawing, "Study for a Tribute to Giorgio Vasari", ca. 1781
medium: Pen and black and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on white laid paper
markings: Watermark:  Mournful heart of the Virgin, with an "M" on top, framed by an escutcheon (?) and a scroll with an inscription
provenance: Ex-Collection: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Minerva dictating to Story, who writes "I STUR[ia]" in a book which the kneeling Saturnus holds on his black.  A genius with two trumpets flies above.  The setting is in a hall with a painter sitting upon a scaffolding and painting a fresco.  Reverse:  pen and chalk sketches of a man climbing a ladder and carrying a package on his head.  Chalk outline of coffers of a ceiling.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study for a Tribute to Giorgio Vasari", ca. 1781.
ca. 1781. Pen and black and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4417.
